paper_abstract: This article studies direct communications between user equipments in the LTE-advanced cellular networks. Different from traditional device-to-device communication technologies such as Bluetooth and WiFi-direct, the operator controls the communication process to provide better user experience and make profit accordingly. The related usage cases and business models are analyzed. Some technical considerations are discussed, and a resource allocation and data transmission procedure is provided.
paper_title: OPERATOR CONTROLLED DEVICE-TO-DEVICE COMMUNICATIONS IN LTE-ADVANCED NETWORKS
